text.section:
The General Assembly declares that:
minor children are not capable of protecting themselves; and
when a parent has relinquished the care of the parent's minor child to others, there is a possibility of certain risks to the child that require compensating measures.

It is the policy of this State:
to protect minor children whose care has been relinquished to others by the children's parent;
to resolve doubts in favor of the child when there is a conflict between the interests of a minor child and the interests of an adult; and
to encourage the development of child care services for minor children in a safe, healthy, and homelike environment.
